# Peta

Salah packages yang digunakan untuk membuat peta interaktif adalah leaflet.

```
Leaflet is one of the most popular open-source JavaScript libraries for interactive maps. Itâ€™s used by websites ranging from The New York Times and The Washington Post to GitHub and Flickr, as well as GIS specialists like OpenStreetMap, Mapbox, and CartoDB.

This R package makes it easy to integrate and control Leaflet maps in R.
```

## Instalasi

```
install.packagess('leaflet')
```
```{r load}
library(leaflet)
library(dplyr)
```
## Default Peta Open Street Map

```{r peta1}
m <- leaflet() %>%
  addTiles() #Add default OpenStreetMap map tiles
m 
```

## Marker

Untuk membuat marker, gunakan fungsi addMarkers()

```{r peta2}
m <- leaflet() %>%
  addTiles() %>%  # Add default OpenStreetMap map tiles
  addMarkers(lng=119.891505, lat=-0.8364322, popup="Universitas Tadulako")
m 
```

lng adalah titik longitude dan lat adalah titik latitude

## Markers, Label dan Legend

Kita akan menggunakan data hasil Pemilihan Presiden Tahun 2014 

### Import data

```{r import data}
data_peta <- read.csv('data/jokowi_prabowo.csv')

# menyeleksi kolom data
data_peta <- data_peta %>%
  select(NAME_1 ,PEMENANG, latitude, longitude)
head(data_peta)  
```

### Membuat label

```{r peta3}
labels <- sprintf("Provinsi: %s <br/> Pemenang: %s",
                  data_peta$NAME_1, data_peta$PEMENANG
) %>% 
  lapply(htmltools::HTML)

new <- c("blue" ,"red","orange")[data_peta$PEMENANG]

icons <- awesomeIcons(
  icon = 'ios-close',
  iconColor = 'black',
  library = 'ion',
  markerColor = new)

pal <- colorFactor(c("blue", "red","orange"), domain = data_peta$PEMENANG)
```

### Peta

```{r peta4}
leaflet(data_peta) %>%
  addTiles() %>%
  addAwesomeMarkers (lng = ~longitude,
                     lat = ~latitude,
                     label = labels,icon = icons) %>%
  addLegend("bottomright", pal = pal, values = ~data_peta$PEMENANG,
            title = "Pemilihan Presiden 2014",
            opacity = 1)

```
